text: Geoffrey Glascott Houghton Page (1929-2002), was a male rower who competed for England. ==Rowing career== He represented England and won a silver medal in the eights and a bronze medal in the coxed fours at the 1954 British Empire and Commonwealth Games in Vancouver, Canada. He was a member of the University College London and Thames Rowing Club. ==Coaching career== He coached at University College School, and Thames RC. ==Personal life== In 1965 he became a journalist for the Sunday Telegraph and then The Daily Telegraph. ==References== Category:1929 births Category:2002 deaths Category:English male rowers Category:Commonwealth Games medallists in rowing Category:Commonwealth Games silver medallists for England Category:Commonwealth Games bronze medallists for England Category:Rowers at the 1954 British Empire and Commonwealth Games
title: Geoffrey Page (rower)
